alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 9:11AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Valley and Phillips Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 25.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:31 AM MDT Thursday was 25.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 23.8 feet by early Saturday morning. It will then rise to 23.9 feet by mid Saturday morning. It will fall to 22.7 feet Monday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.5 feet on 10/01/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM MDT.
